LOBL.content: judgment as that which is impossible to reach in each crisis, arrêt, decision
LOBL.linkedContent: judgment as that which is impossible to reach in each crisis, arrêt, decision

FL.content: judge—calculating machine, decision to calculate is not of the order of the calculable
FL.linkedContent: judge—calculating machine, decision to calculate is not of the order of the calculable

SPOM.content: Marx insists on discerning, the price of the krinein of the critique: he’s out to get the specter, not the spirit, believing in a decontaminating purification
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx insists on discerning, the price of the krinein of the critique: he’s out to get the specter, not the spirit, believing in a decontaminating purification

HERP.content: Heidegger critiques or enacts “destruction” of Aristotle’s broken theory of logos as judgment, but remains Aristotelian when saying only Dasein can have a friend—animal has no ear
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger critiques or enacts “destruction” of Aristotle’s broken theory of logos as judgment, but remains Aristotelian when saying only Dasein can have a friend—animal has no ear

A.content: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)

VM.content: Heidegger calls original dissimulation of Being beneath the existent, prior to any error in judgment, erring (Irren), every epoch is in an epoch of erring
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger calls original dissimulation of Being beneath the existent, prior to any error in judgment, erring (Irren), every epoch is in an epoch of erring

VP.content: for Husserl, “S is P” is original apophantic operation, the fundamental, primitive form [see p. 84]
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, “S is P” is original apophantic operation, the fundamental, primitive form [see p. 84]

PP.content: for Plato, only truth as presence of the present is discriminative > discrimination become so subtle it separates nothing, the same from itself (this movement is only possible within structure of ambiguity and reversibility of pharmakon)
PP.linkedContent: for Plato, only truth as presence of the present is discriminative > discrimination become so subtle it separates nothing, the same from itself (this movement is only possible within structure of ambiguity and reversibility of pharmakon)

OH.content: crisis is not appropriate word any more for event of other heading: crisis [krinein, moment of decision] has always inspired a Selbstbesinnung (self-contemplation), a regaining of “direction (sens)” > protestant, capital discourse
OH.linkedContent: crisis is not appropriate word any more for event of other heading: crisis [krinein, moment of decision] has always inspired a Selbstbesinnung (self-contemplation), a regaining of “direction (sens)” > protestant, capital discourse

SH.content: tragic inversion of shibboleth, corruption of its differential value, from condition of alliance to discriminating limit, policing, normalization, methodical subjugation
SH.linkedContent: tragic inversion of shibboleth, corruption of its differential value, from condition of alliance to discriminating limit, policing, normalization, methodical subjugation

SH.content: to bless no one, only chance for an act of faith > otherwise dogma, certainty, judgment
SH.linkedContent: to bless no one, only chance for an act of faith > otherwise dogma, certainty, judgment

FWT.content: mustn’t crush dimensions of living being [biology, cultural] into each other, all life (animal & human) survives by knowing how to discern (btwn forms of life, btwn “living” and “dead”)
FWT.linkedContent: mustn’t crush dimensions of living being [biology, cultural] into each other, all life (animal & human) survives by knowing how to discern (btwn forms of life, btwn “living” and “dead”)

DS.content: literary criticism, linked to possibility of decidability, to krinein, goes into crisis > Cris de vers
DS.linkedContent: literary criticism, linked to possibility of decidability, to krinein, goes into crisis > Cris de vers

DS.content: “literary criticism” —ontological interpretation of mimesis? krinein proceeds precisely from out of that which is being threatened by the re-tempering (retrempe) of literature
DS.linkedContent: “literary criticism” —ontological interpretation of mimesis? krinein proceeds precisely from out of that which is being threatened by the re-tempering (retrempe) of literature

P.content: for Kant, problem of communication btwn aesthetic judgment and organic finality is internal
P.linkedContent: for Kant, problem of communication btwn aesthetic judgment and organic finality is internal

P.content: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > pure philosophy sews everything up, includes critique w/in
P.linkedContent: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > pure philosophy sews everything up, includes critique w/in

P.content: critique detaches, only a moment, related to desire, pleasure/unpleasure, Spur ——question of Urteil, of function of copula
P.linkedContent: critique detaches, only a moment, related to desire, pleasure/unpleasure, Spur ——question of Urteil, of function of copula

P.content: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once
P.linkedContent: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once

ATIA.content: for Descartes, the specter/ghost “conjured” by judgment is simulacrum of “real man,” spectral man as animal-machine, this animal-machine we’re trying to “flush out”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Descartes, the specter/ghost “conjured” by judgment is simulacrum of “real man,” spectral man as animal-machine, this animal-machine we’re trying to “flush out”

ATIA.content: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure
ATIA.linkedContent: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure

SW.content: “this very mild, this terrible Paul” > whose monstrous progeniture are our history/culture, he points to nature & tells us to judge for ourselves [re: woman wearing veils]
SW.linkedContent: “this very mild, this terrible Paul” > whose monstrous progeniture are our history/culture, he points to nature & tells us to judge for ourselves [re: woman wearing veils]

CHM.content: no error in perception for Descartes, only in will of judgment [like Aristotle]
CHM.linkedContent: no error in perception for Descartes, only in will of judgment [like Aristotle]

TR.content: disturbing proximity btwn pardon & last judgment (which pardon is not, pardon does not judge, foreign to courtroom), as close as possible to verdict
TR.linkedContent: disturbing proximity btwn pardon & last judgment (which pardon is not, pardon does not judge, foreign to courtroom), as close as possible to verdict

AFR.content: for Condillac, error & obscurity only in judgment not perception [like Aristotle, like Descartes]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, error & obscurity only in judgment not perception [like Aristotle, like Descartes]

LI.content: jugement d’autorité: preferred method/practice of all dogmatism
LI.linkedContent: jugement d’autorité: preferred method/practice of all dogmatism

BSi.content: if bêtise not an error (bad judgment) but hebetated (dulled) judgment, aptitude for wrong judgment, it could be there in absolute knowledge [stupidity of encyclopedic knowledge]
BSi.linkedContent: if bêtise not an error (bad judgment) but hebetated (dulled) judgment, aptitude for wrong judgment, it could be there in absolute knowledge [stupidity of encyclopedic knowledge]

BSi.content: if bêtise is not an error [Deleuze’s stance], no pragamatic use of bêtise does not refer (if obscurely) to abyss of jus (justice, justness, judge) [not faulty judgment but judgment of judge, judgment from which one expects some justness]
BSi.linkedContent: if bêtise is not an error [Deleuze’s stance], no pragamatic use of bêtise does not refer (if obscurely) to abyss of jus (justice, justness, judge) [not faulty judgment but judgment of judge, judgment from which one expects some justness]

BSi.content: from apophantics to apophatics: trying to describe bêtise [vertigo]
BSi.linkedContent: from apophantics to apophatics: trying to describe bêtise [vertigo]

OG.content: Rousseau & Descartes [Aristotle too]: our senses never deceive us, only our judgments
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau & Descartes [Aristotle too]: our senses never deceive us, only our judgments

EU.content: Kant’s “heroic” effort to mark off juridical borders btwn 2 classes of [university] faculties > freedom of judgment, philosophy, the unconditioned condition w/out which there is no university
EU.linkedContent: Kant’s “heroic” effort to mark off juridical borders btwn 2 classes of [university] faculties > freedom of judgment, philosophy, the unconditioned condition w/out which there is no university
